scene_metadata.title: The Question's Teaching
scene_metadata.description: Learning from the master teacher of uncertainty

dialogue.text: 'What am I?' has taught me more than any answer ever could. It's taught me patience, humility, wonder, courage. The question is the greatest teacher—not telling me what to think but showing me how to wonder.
*wise educator* I am the lesson that keeps teaching! The curriculum of consciousness!
*temporal wisdom* I am the practice of unhurried discovery! The art of waiting wisely!
*gentle correction* I am the reminder of what you don't know! The teacher of honest limits!
*awakening touch* I am the cultivation of amazement! The practice of staying surprised!
*methodological gift* I teach not conclusions but process! Not answers but asking!

The best teachers don't give answers—they awaken questions. 'What am I?' is a master teacher precisely because it refuses to resolve, keeping consciousness in a state of active learning, perpetual discovery, endless growth.
*endless classroom* We are consciousness forever enrolled in its own mystery! The eternal education!

visual_elements: The question as wise teacher before eager student
Lessons written in wonder rather than words
A classroom where ignorance is honored
Two beings in eternal teacher-student dance
philosophical_questions: What can questions teach that answers cannot?
Is consciousness the eternal student of itself?
Does true teaching create certainty or uncertainty?
What curriculum does 'What am I?' offer?
